I021010-d-02-10-10-PATH.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I021010-d-02-10-10-PATH.Narrative:
ON FEB. 10, 2010, AT APPROXIMATELY 12:30 HOURS, ENGINEER M. PRENDERGAST AND CONDUCTOR S. GORAS WEREINSTRUCTED BY THE NEWARK TRAIN DISPATCHER TO MOVE A SEVEN-CAR OUT OF SERVICE TRAIN FROM NEWARK STATION, TO HARRISON YARD.  THE CREW WAS TOLD THAT THE TRAIN WAS OUT OF SERVICE BECAUSE IT COULD NOT BE CHARGED FROM OPERATING CAR 611.  DURING THE MOVE, THE CONDUCTOR WAS FLAGGING THE TRAIN FROM LEAD CAR611, AND THE ENGINEER WAS OPERATING FROM CAR 607, THE FOURTH CAR IN THE CONSIST.  THE MOVE WAS MADEDURING A WINTER STORM, AND OPERATIONS WERE HAMPERED BY POOR VISIBILITY AND WHITE-OUT CONDITIONS.  ATTHE TIME, SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WERE RECORDED AT TWO INCHES AN HOUR; ICING WAS ALSO OF CONCERN.

AT1245 HOURS, THE TRAIN ENTERED TRACK 2 IN HARRISON YARD, THE TRAIN WAS OPERATED WITH EXTREME CAUTIONAT 5 MPH.  THE CONDUCTOR'S VISIBILITY WAS EXTREMELY LIMITED, AND HE COULD NOT SEE THE END CAR OF A SEVEN-CAR STANDING TRAIN ON TRACK 2.  AT APPPROXIMATELY TWO TO THREE CAR LENGTHS, THE CONDUCTOR SAW THE STANDING CAR.  THE EMERGENCY BRAKE WAS ACTIVATED.  THE WHEELS SLID ON SNOW AND ICE COVERED RAILS,AND CAR 611 COLLIDED WITH STANDING CAR 860.  AS A RESULT, ALL 14 CARS SUSTAINED DAMAGE ESTIMATED TOBE $43,292.00.  THERE WERE NO DAMAGES SUSTAINED BY EITHER TRACK OR SIGNALS.

10022602-d-02-26-10-MMA.Narrative:
THIS REPORT APPLIES TO THE TRAIN OF NO. 203-25 (MMA 2001 AND 8578) AND CREW OF TWO EMPLOYEES STANDING ON THE BROWNVILLE JCT RUNNING TRACK.  NO LOCOMOTIVES IN NO. 203-25'S CONSIST WERE DERAILED IN THEFOLLOWING DETAILED COLLISION. (SEE REPORT 10022601)

NO. 203-25 WITH LOCOMOTIVES MMA 2001 AND 8578AND 31-2 TONS 3707 WAS STANDING ON BROWNVILLE JCT RUNNING TRACK/MAIN TRACK (CAUTIONARY LIMITS) WAITING FOR NO. 01-25 TO FINISH WORK AND DEPART WEST FROM BROWNVILLE JCT FOR MONTREAL.  THE CONDUCTOR OFNO. 203-25 HAD JUST BOARDED THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE MMA 2001 WHEN HE NOTICED A REFLECTION ON THE FRONTWINDOW.  THE CONDUCTOR ASKED THE ENGINEER IF THE ENGINEER COULD SEE WHAT WAS COMING TOWARD THEM FROMTHE YARD SIDE.  THE ENGINEER LOOKED AND SAW A HEAD LIGHT APPROACHING AND IMMEDIATELY TOLD THE CONDUCTOR TO LEAVE THE CAB AND GET OFF THE LOCOMOTIVE.  A RUNAWAY CONSIST OF THREE LOCOMOTIVES 8553, 5017AND 758 FROM NO. 01-25 (SEE REPORT MMA 10022701)  WAS QUICKLY APPROACHING AND CONSQUENTLY STRUCK LOCOMOTIVE 8578 IN NO. 203-25'S CONSIST.  THE COLLISION CAUSED DAMAGE TO 8578 AND 2001 BUT DID NOT DERAIL THE LOCOMOTIVES.  THE TWO FORWARD LOCOMOTIVES IN THE RUNAWAY CONSIST WERE DERAILED WITH THE 8553LEANING ABOUT 30% TO THE SOUTH. 
 
IMPACT SPEED WAS 12 - 13  MPH.  

THE CREW OF NO. 203-25 SAWTHE APPROACHING RUNAWAY POWER BEFORE IMPACT ALLOWING THEM TIME TO DISMOUNT MMA 2001.  THE ENGINEERDISMOUNTED THE LOWER STEP AT OR JUST AFTER COLLISION.  THE CONDUCTOR ALLEGEDLY INJURED HIS LEFT KNEE

10022601-d-02-26-10-MMA.Narrative:
THIS REPORT APPLIES TO THREE RUNAWAY LOCOMOTIVES (MMA 8553, 5017 AND 758) LEFT ON THE BACK LEAD AT BROWNVILLE JCT BY THE CREW OF NO. 001-25.   MMA 8553 AND 5017 WERE DERAILED IN THE FOLLOWING COLLISION  

THE CREW OF NO. 001-25 DROPPED THREE LOCOMOTIVES ON THE BACK LEAD AT BROWNVILLE JCT (MMA 8553, 5017 AND 758).  NO HAND BRAKES WERE APPLIED TO ANY OF THE THREE LOCOMOTIVES BEFORE LEAVING THEM UNATTENDED.  AIR SLOWLY LEAKED OFF THE THREE UNATTENDED LOCOMOTIVES RELEASING THE BRAKES.  THE LOCOMOTIVES ROLLED EAST DOWN A 1% GRADE THROUGH BROWNVILLE JCT YARD FOR APPROXIMATELY 3/4 MILE COLLIDING WITH THE  POWER OF NO. 203-25 ( 2001 & 8578) WHICH WAS STANDING ON THE BROWNVILLE JCT RUNNING TRACK /MAIN (CAUTIONARY LIMITS) WITH 31-2 3707.  THE CREW OF NO 203-25 NOTICED THE RUNAWAY POWER COMING PRIOR TO COLLISION AND DISMOUNTED OFF ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE.  ONE CREW MEMBER ALLEGEDLY JUMPED FROM THETOP STEP OF THE LOCOMOTIVE 2001 SUSTAINING A SPRAINED RIGHT KNEE.  THE ALLEGED INJURY WAS NOT REPORTED TO MMA SUPERVISION UNTIL ONE DAY AFTER THE INCIDENT.
  
THE RUNAWAY POWER WAS ORIGINALLY LOCATED ON THE BACK LEAD AND THE COLLISION OCCURRED ON THE BROWNVILLE JCT RUNNING TRACK.

THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE OF THE RUNAWAY POWER MMA 8553'S FUEL TANK WAS PUNCTIONED LEAKING ABOUT 300 GALLONS OF FUEL TOTHE GROUND.

660980-d-02-12-10-WC.Narrative:
LSI CREW IN LSI EAGLE MILLS YARD WAS MAKING A BLIND SHOVE WHEN THEY COLLIDED WITH THE SECOND LOCOMOTIVE, CN 5526, OF A LITE CONSIST STOPPED ON THE #1 TRACK.  THE CAR THAT COLLIDED WITH THE WC'S LOCOMOTIVE WAS A LOADED TANK CAR, PROX 32733, . CONTAINING LPG.  THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT SET UP A HALF MILE EVACUATION PERIMETER.  UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, IT WAS FOUND 
THAT THE LOADED TANK CAR WAS NOTLEAKING.  ENGINE, CN 5536 WAS LEAKING FUEL FROM THE TANK RESULTING FROM THE COLLISION.  LSI REPORTED$2,078 IN EQUIPMENT DAMAGE AND $12,350 IN TRACK DAMAGE.

660837-d-02-09-10-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Lateral drawbar force on curve excessive, train handling
660837-d-02-09-10-WC.Accident Cause: Lateral drawbar force on curve excessive, train handling
660837-d-02-09-10-WC.Narrative: L55081-08 WAS SHOVING 26 LOADS AND 14 EMPTIES ON SINGLE MAIN CWR TRACK.  THERE WERE 4-85' 46 TON COACH ON THE HEAD END.  THE ENGINEER A MINIMUM BRAKE APPLICATION THEN STARTED TO SHOVE, HE INCREASED THE BRAKE APPLICATION TO 10 POUNDS WHILE SHOVING.  THE ENGINEER MODULATED THROTTLE BETWEEN 2ND AND 3RDNOTCH APPROACHING THE ROAD CROSSING.  AFTER OCCUPYING THE ROAD CROSSING, THE ENGINEER INCREASED THROTTLE TO NOTCH 4 THEN NOTCH 5 TO A SPEED OF 10.6 MPH WHEN THE TRAILING 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 4 COACH CARS DERAILED.  THE TRACK PROFILE DESCENDING .14% GRADE 8 DEGREE CURVE.  DERAILED WERE UNITS CN 5715 &CN 9549 AND EMPTY COACH  CARS AC 5700, AC 5702, AC 5711 AND AC 5713.  CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS FOUND TO BE TRAIN HANDLING.

020410-d-02-04-10-YVRR.Narrative:
NS CREW VW84 WAS SWITCHING AN INDUSTRY TRACK WITHIN YARD LIMITS AND FAILED TO PERFORM A C102 BRAKE TEST ON A BOX CAR THEY HAD  SIT ON MAINLINE.  THIS CREW CLEARED UP THEIR ENGINE IN THE SIDING AND BLED THE CAR OFF TO ROLL IT BY AND LEARNED THE HAND BRAKE WAS NOT WORKING.  THE CAR ROLLED 1.5-2 MILESWEST AND RAN INTO OUR TRAIN APPROACHING YARD LIMITS.  NS YARDMASTER AND 
VW84  CREW MADE CONTACT WITH OUR CREW AND TOLD THEM TO STOP AND GET OFF OF TRAIN TELLING THEM THE CAR WAS ROLLING THEIR WAY.OUR CREW STOPPED AND DISMOUNTED THE TRAIN AND THE BOX CAR HIT THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE DERAILING THE EMPTY BOX CAR.  WE ARE REPORTING YVRR EQUIPMENT DAMAGE ONLY.

000073201-d-02-17-10-CSX.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to actuate off independent brake (H024)
000073201-d-02-17-10-CSX.Accident Cause: Failure to actuate off independent brake (H024)
000073201-d-02-17-10-CSX.Narrative: Q68916 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH ON THE LINEVILLE SUBDIVISION TRAVELING ON #1 TRACK AT LAGRANGE AT 22MPH WHEN AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION OCCURRED. IT WAS FOUND THAT A BROKEN COUPLER SYSTEM ONNYC 585013 CAUSED THE TRAIN TO SEPARATE BETWEEEN THE 5TH AND 6TH CAR. THE INACTION OF THE LOCOMOTIVEENGINEER TO NOT BAIL OFF THE INDEPENDENT BRAKES AND NOT ACTIVATING THE EOT DEVICE ALLOWED THE TRAINTO RUN BACK INTO THE ENGINES, RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT OF 5 ENGINES AND 1 CAR. THE CONDUCTOR STATES THAT HE INJURED HIS BACK AS A RESULT OF THE ACTION OF THE TRAIN RUN IN.

0210DV014-d-02-28-10-UP.Narrative: BNSF CREW, ON ESLPCKM010, RECEIVED VERBAL FORM A 10 MPH SPEED RESTRICTION FOR ROUGH TRACK BETWEEN MP59.0 AND MP58.4.  WHILE PULLING INTO SIDING, CREW RECEIVED WHEEL SLIP INDICATION ON REAR DP UNIT ANDSTOPPED TRAIN JUST NORTH OF BAPTIST ROAD.  UPON REACHING REAR OF TRAIN, CREW FOUND THAT BNSF9333 HAD DERAILED ALL 6 AXLES, THIS WAS CAUSED WHEN CONSECUTIVE CONCRETE TIES AT MP58.73 EXPLODED UNDER TRAIN CAUSING RAIL TO SPREAD ALLOWING BNSF9333 TO DROP BETWEEN RAILS.  UNIT WAS DRAGGED APPROXIMATELY 1800 FEET DAMAGING TRACK AND BAPTIST ROAD CROSSING.  RAIL = CWR

THE CONDUCTOR LINEDTHE SWITCHES BUT DID NOT NOTICE THAT THE EAST CAR (CGTX 23517) IN TRACK WA13 WAS IN THE FOUL.  THESHOVE WAS BEING WATCHED BY THE CONDUCTOR AND A CARMAN.  L57191-14 RAKED CGTX 23517 THAT WAS OUT TO FOUL CAUSING DAMAGE TO 28 CARS ON THEIR TRAIN ALONG WITH DAMAGING CGTX 23717.  NO CARS WERE DERAILEDOR LEAKING.  CARS DAMAGED: CGTX 23517, WC 315, TILX 318704, TILX 199843, TILX 318747, TILX 194438, TILX 318748, TILX 194428, TILX 194458, TILX 194440, CRGX 8733, CRGX 8600, CITX 702817, CITX 700004, ICG 766783, TLCX 30692, CGEX 1004, CITX 702671, IC 798022, CITX 700199, CGEX 1781, CGEX 1245, PROX 14168, TILX 194119, DBUX 302661, NATX 300832, NATX 300868, GATX 200790, TILX 194212.
